application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: T.1 Hawthorn - Fell.T.2 Larch - Fell.
decision_conditions: Under the provisions of sections 206 and 213 of the Act, the owner of the land upon which the above tree(s) are to be removed is under a duty to plant one replacement tree of appropriate size and species, per tree under TPO removed according to the above list. These should be planted as close to the original tree(s) as possible unless otherwise agreed with the Council's Tree Officer - IN THIS INSTANCE THE TWO REPLACEMENT TREES MAY BE PLANTED WITHIN THE BACK GARDEN BUT ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE IN THE SAME LOCATION. The replacement trees should be planted within the first planting season (Oct 1st - April 30th) following the proposed removals.The size of the tree shall be a standard with a height of 2.50 metres, a minimum stem height of 1.75 metres and a girth of 8cm to 10cm to conform with BS 3936 Part 1 (1992).Any replacement trees which within a period of five years from planting are removed, die or become seriously damaged/diseased shall be replaced within the next planting season (Oct 1st to April 30th) with trees of similar amenity value.Any replacement planting should be carried out with due consideration for overhead and underground services, property boundaries, buildings and potential maintenance. The eventual size of a specimen and the nature of its rooting structure should also be taken into account when choosing where to plant, in order to achieve the best result for your site.The following will be suitable replacement species:(a) Stella American Sweetgum (Liquidambar styraciflua 'Stella') as replacement for T.1 of TPO No. RBK.07.90.(b) lane Roberts American Sweetgum (Liquidambar styraciflua 'Lane Roberts') as replacement for T.2 of TPO No. RBK.07.90.I have to warn you that if the two replacements specified above are not planted by the end of the first planting season (Oct 1st to April 30th) following the proposed removals, a notice may be served under section 207 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). However, I trust that such action will not be necessary and I look forward to receiving your full cooperation in this matter. Please ensure that you inform the Council's Tree Officer (ben.morgan@kingston.gov.uk) with the provision of a photo once the replanting has taken place.
